text: Anthony Duclair (born August 26, 1995) is a Canadian ice hockey left winger. He currently plays for the Florida Panthers of the National Hockey League (NHL). He has also played for the New York Rangers, Arizona Coyotes, Chicago Blackhawks, Columbus Blue Jackets, and Ottawa Senators. He was born in Montreal, Quebec, and he grew up in Pointe-Claire, Montreal, Quebec. ==Career== Before playing in the NHL, Duclair played 3 seasons with the Quebec Remparts of the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League (QMJHL). During his time with the Remparts, Duclair was able to score 50 goals in 59 games during the 2013–14 QMJHL season. Due to his impressive feat, he was named to the QMJHL First All-Star Team. He was drafted 80th overall by the New York Rangers in the 2013 NHL Entry Draft. On January 2, 2014, he was signed to a three-year entry-level contract as a free agent by the New York Rangers. On October 27, 2014, Duclair scored his first NHL goal against Darcy Kuemper of the Minnesota Wild. On March 1, 2015, the Rangers traded Duclair to the Arizona Coyotes along with John Moore and two draft picks, in exchange for Keith Yandle and Chris Summers. On October 14, 2015, Duclair scored his first NHL career hat- trick in a 4–0 shutout win against the Anaheim Ducks. ==References== == Other websites == * Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Arizona Coyotes players Category:Black Canadian sportspeople Category:Canadian ice hockey left wingers Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Columbus Blue Jackets players Category:Ice hockey people from Quebec Category:New York Rangers players Category:Ottawa Senators players Category:Quebec Remparts players Category:Sportspeople from Montreal Category:Tucson Roadrunners players
title: Anthony Duclair
